metadata.name: Pixel Heartbeats (animated) #175
metadata.description:
A uniquely generated animated pixel art piece, reminiscent of a beating heart. Based on a 2013 gif piece of mine, the rigidness of the collection's extra large pixels meet organic generative shapes and natural feeling rhythms, resulting in a mood somewhere between the biological and digital worlds.


Each piece features a unique, sharply rendered generative pixel art with a special heartbeat animation rhythm. The collection also includes exciting color and resolution rarity variations.


--


60% Standard red heart colors
35% Unique rare color variants
5% Special "Shiny" animated color


45% low-fi pixel art animations
45% mid-fi pixel art animations
10% hi-fi pixel art animations


Thanks for stopping by and hope you enjoy!

metadata.name: Morixels Colab #2 MoriCar #59
metadata.description:
We all dream of having a car or we have

Some of us even talk to our car

And some of us see our car like a cartoon character.

This collection is not only an NFT but also a match
If you win one of the cups, in addition to a Super Rare edition, there are also prizes for the owners in the Primary market, which are as follows:
The lucky winners of the Gold Cup amount to 10 Tezos
The lucky winners of the Silver Cup amount to 5 Tezos
The lucky winners of the Bronze Cup amount to 3 Tezos

The MoriCar is unique random Generated 200 PFP NFTs. The number of Traits in this collection is 7 (78 layers) and it has the ability to make unique 3,492,720 NFTs.

To create balance, these NFTs are randomly minted, and this is a chance for everyone to get a rare version. So due to the low price of these NFTs, if the rare version did not belong to you, it is still possible for you to mint the new NFTs.

Because this is an NFT in PFP format, you can put it on your avatar on Twitter or Instagram.

This project is a collaboration project and it is a Benefit for the owners of the most Morixels to Collaborate with Morixels Designer.

You can read more information on Morixels website 👇

Website: https://morixels.com/

Twitter: @Morixels

by: @morteza_yousefy & @ardavan_
Made in 2022

metadata.name: fxhash x thi.ng project template #621
metadata.description:
THIS IS NOT AN ARTWORK (at least not intentional)!

This NFT acts as a donation/funding mechanism for a new project template Git repo, providing a compact, ready-to-go scaffolding for generative art projects aimed at the fx(hash) platform/marketplace.

https://github.com/thi-ng/fxhash-tpl

This template evolved over time and has served as basis for some of the author's own NFT projects (https://www.fxhash.xyz/u/toxi). The template is aimed at TypeScript (but can be easily adapted to plain JavaScript) and, at the time of writing, uses Vite as dev & build tool, ensuring an altogether great & speedy workflow with minimal fuzz.

(In the future, I'm aiming to provide an alternative version for more advanced hybrid projects using TypeScript, Zig (https://ziglang.org) and WebAssembly (https://webassembly.org/)...)

Framework agnostic

Even though several packages from the https://thi.ng/umbrella ecosystem are used to provide various essential overarching functionality, the template is organized in such a way that the main parts are completely framework-agnostic. You should be able to easily plug in your own toolkit of choice, however I cannot promise to provide support for this myself (though happy to accept PRs, also in terms of further docs, how-tos, guides etc.)

Example project

A tiny, fully documented throwaway example sketch is included, illustrating the following:

- Overall project structure & build commands
- FXhash related setup
- Static & dynamic configuration and state (re)initialization (via dependency graph)
- FXhash PRNG wrapper & utilities
- Canvas & SVG conversion/export/download
- 2D geometry creation, transformation & drawing
- Basic vector algebra example usage


Keyboard shortcuts

- space :  pause/play animation
- x : download canvas as PNG
- s : download SVG version

In case of doubt, it's this example project what is used here for minting. The funding, however, will be used for the further maintenance of both this project template and supporting my other open source work. 20% are also donated to the FXhash development team itself.

Thank you for your support! 🙏😍

metadata.name: Breakers #94
metadata.description:
Companion project to Neural Collapse (#15780), for the collectors of my previous efforts.
A study on the repetition and stacking of a simple dynamic structure, this time inside a cylinder.

Everything procedurally generated at runtime.

Interactivity : 
- You can click on each individual breaker to open or close them. The problem is it will toggle others.
- Press and hold the mouse button to slightly move the viewpoint. The previous interaction not being disabled while doing that, you get some switching all over the place as a bonus bug/feature.

- Press "a" to increase quality of the antialiasing (3 levels), at the cost of performances. If you don't like jaggies and your machine can take it.
- Export a PNG capture at various resolutions by pressing the number keys 1 to 9 (top row or numpad, and only in live mode, after pressing "open"). Resolutions ranges from 720 to 7680 pixels. I recommend starting with "4".

GPU recommended. Best performances on Chrome in general.

metadata.name: Breakers #12
metadata.description:
Companion project to Neural Collapse (#15780), for the collectors of my previous efforts.
A study on the repetition and stacking of a simple dynamic structure, this time inside a cylinder.

Everything procedurally generated at runtime.

Interactivity : 
- You can click on each individual breaker to open or close them. The problem is it will toggle others.
- Press and hold the mouse button to slightly move the viewpoint. The previous interaction not being disabled while doing that, you get some switching all over the place as a bonus bug/feature.

- Press "a" to increase quality of the antialiasing (3 levels), at the cost of performances. If you don't like jaggies and your machine can take it.
- Export a PNG capture at various resolutions by pressing the number keys 1 to 9 (top row or numpad, and only in live mode, after pressing "open"). Resolutions ranges from 720 to 7680 pixels. I recommend starting with "4".

GPU recommended. Best performances on Chrome in general.

metadata.name: Illusion City #112
metadata.description:
Illusion City reflects the variety of Istanbul by its different and divergent zones, day and night, humid summers and ice cold winters, colorful neighborhoods and giant plazas, its never ending human and vehicle traffic.

This series is an expression of how we experience this city, kind of like a love and hate relationship. The city that is a cradle of civilizations now has become a concrete jungle. Our beautiful city and its citizens are now trying to find their own balance in this state of chaos.

We wanted to express these complex emotions with a long-form generative artwork since it is the most suitable medium to explore every possible combination of emotions we have about our city. 

Best experienced in full screen.

Probabilities;

- 3 pre-made color palettes, 1 generative color palette

- 3 blend modes

- 3 topping placements

- 8 different particle angle compositions

- Several grid sizes and edges

- An intentionally kept in glitch (rare)

In live mode, press ‘s’ to save as .png (2000 x 2666 px )

It can take up to a minute to render or longer in low-performance computers. Enjoy the process!

Made with p5.js

Ilgın İçözü, July 2022
@distcollective

metadata.name: Polar Grid #894
metadata.description:
Polar Grid is part of the fxhash live minting experience at Proof of People, London 2022.

This is a study of color, motion, and composition, and an homage to cinema as an artform. Colorful shapes overlap and pulse in a ever repeating dance. An abstracted movie experience. Each color palette in the series (except one) is inspired by a different film director (if you want a real challenge, see how many you can guess without looking at the feature names).

The palettes were extracted from movie stills or movie posters and fine tuned by hand. As often, I have to thank independent tool makers for their indirect help. My gratitude goes to David Aerne for FarbVélo and Fabrizio Bianchi for Coolors.

The code for Polar Grid is based on early iterations of what ultimately became my carat series. Both projects come from the same fascination for color as a system, even though I used a different approach here. You could call this a carat prequel.

The animation is done using a technique called polar noise. This makes it so the motion of all elements ends up repeating in the same amount of time. This is useful for generating motion that loops perfectly while still appearing organic. In this particular case, the animation repeats every π × 100 seconds.

A challenge in building any generative system is to find the right balance between coherence and variety. I designed the system with the large edition size in mind. During development I generated hundreds of iterations and tweaked my code to make sure that every iteration is truly unique and fits the overall aesthetic of the collection.

I truly hope you will enjoy your own little abstract movie.

— Raphaël de Courville


Released: July 6th 2022

Medium: p5.js, html canvas, css

Reference: sk220621


**About the artist**

Raphaël de Courville is a generative artist, streamer, and educator. His artistic work is an exploration of generative systems, patterns, interactivity, and time. Born in Paris, he lives and works in Berlin.


**Instructions**

- Click/Tap or press SPACEBAR to play and pause the animation

In Fullscreen mode (desktop only):
- Press UP or DOWN arrows to adjust image quality (Note: this can affect performance)
- Press F to hide/show the browser UI

Color Pallet has 10 variations.

- Press [f] to switch full screen on and off
- Press [s] to download a PNG file with windowsize
- Press [l] to download a PNG file with large size 4800 pixel (wait a minutes)

Create with p5.js
